com.camerontec.util.data

Interface Buffer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BufferOnByteArray, BufferOnByteBuffer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBuffer, AbstractSafeBuffer, BytesSegmentBuffer, DirectBuffer, SafeBufferOnByteArray, SafeBufferOnByteBuffer, UnsafeBuffer

    public interface Buffer
    Interface for classes which can behave as a view over a byte array.

    The source and location of the underlying byte array is implementation dependent and not defined here.

    Whether auxiliary state associated with the underlying byte array is maintained is implementation dependent and not defined here.

    This is conceptually a low level interface and clients are expected to use accordingly. The behaviour should a client attempt to read or write beyond the buffer capacity is implementation dependent and therefore not defined here.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ByteOrder SUGGESTED_DEFAULT_BYTE_ORDER
      The suggested default byte order to be used by implementations for which there is no other obvious default.

    • Field Detail

      • SUGGESTED_DEFAULT_BYTE_ORDER

        static final ByteOrder SUGGESTED_DEFAULT_BYTE_ORDER
        The suggested default byte order to be used by implementations for which there is no other obvious default.

    • Method Detail

      • getByteOrder

        ByteOrder getByteOrder()
        Return the byte order.
        Returns:
        The byte order.

      • setByteOrder

        ByteOrder setByteOrder(ByteOrder byteOrder)
        Set the byte order.

        The native byte order for the current platform is available via java.nio.ByteOrder.byteOrder().

        Parameters:
        byteOrder - The new byte order.
        Returns:
        The old byte order.

      • capacity

        int capacity()
        Return the buffer capacity.
        Returns:
        The buffer capacity. If the buffer implementation has no fixed maximum capacity, or is dynamically sized, then this method returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.

      • copy

        int copy(int sourceIndex,
         int targetIndex,
         int length)
        Copy a contiguous chunk of length bytes from the sourceIndex to the targetIndex.
        Parameters:
        sourceIndex - The index of the bytes to copy.
        targetIndex - The index to copy the bytes to.
        length - The number of bytes to copy.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes copied.

      • getByte

        byte getByte(int index)
        Return the byte at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index.
        Returns:
        The byte.

      • putByte

        int putByte(int index,
            byte value)
        Copy a byte into the buffer at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index.
        value - The byte.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes copied.

      • getBytes

        int getBytes(int index,
             byte[] target)
        Copy all available bytes, from the specified index, into the target buffer.
        Parameters:
        index - The index.
        target - The target buffer.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes copied. This can be smaller than the available bytes available if the target buffer does not have sufficient capacity.

      • putBytes

        int putBytes(int index,
             byte[] source)
        Copy a byte array into the buffer at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index.
        source - The byte array to copy.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes copied.

      • getBytes

        int getBytes(int index,
             byte[] target,
             int offset,
             int length)
        Copy up to length bytes, from the specified index, into the target buffer starting at the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        index - The index.
        target - The target buffer.
        offset - The target buffer offset.
        length - The maximum number of bytes to copy.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes copied. This can be smaller than length if there were fewer bytes available in the buffer.

      • putBytes

        int putBytes(int index,
             byte[] source,
             int offset,
             int length)
        Copy length bytes from a byte array, starting at offset, into the buffer at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index.
        source - The byte array to copy.
        offset - The offset from which to copy.
        length - The number of bytes to copy.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes copied.

      • getBoolean

        boolean getBoolean(int index)
        Get the boolean value at the specified buffer index.

        Note that the method by which a boolean value is encoded is not specified. Therefore an accurate boolean value may only be retrieved if previously written via putBoolean(int, boolean).

        Parameters:
        index - The index.
        Returns:
        The boolean value at the specified index.

        int putBoolean(int index,
               boolean value)
        Put a boolean value at the specified buffer index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index.
        value - The boolean value.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written.

      • getString

        MutableString getString(int index,
                        MutableString value,
                        int length)
        Get the string value at the specified buffer index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index.
        value - The value to be populated. The value is cleared before being populated, so any existing characters are overridden as a side effect of population.
        length - The original MutableString length.
        Returns:
        The supplied value.
